thread.title: Suspect sought after girl assaulted in Flemingdon Park | CTV Toronto News
thread.title_full: Suspect sought after girl assaulted in Flemingdon Park | CTV Toronto News

author: Sandie Benitah
title: Suspect sought after girl assaulted in Flemingdon Park | CTV Toronto News
text:
Suspect sought after girl assaulted in Flemingdon Park Sandie Benitah, CTV News Toronto Published Wednesday, February 22, 2017 9:47PM EST Last Updated Wednesday, February 22, 2017 9:50PM EST 
A 15-year-old girl managed to escape a man who grabbed her by the head and dragged her to a remote area of Flemingdon Park, Toronto police say. 
The girl was walking in the area of Gateway Boulevard and Don Mills Road around 4:45 p.m. Tuesday as a man approached her. She was then sexually assaulted, police said. 
The teen confronted the man and according to investigators, thatâ€™s when she was grabbed by the head and taken to a remote area. She managed to break free and run away. 
Police are now looking for a suspect who they have described as man in his 20s, with tanned skin. He is about five-foot-six, is balding with short black hair, has dark brown eyes and was clean shaven at the time. He was last seen wearing a black jacket without a hood, grey pants, and black and white Nike Air sneakers.
